item.title: Persona Live 2026: Awakenings Is Bringing The Series' Best Music To The U.S. With Just Two Shows
item.content:encoded:
Sega and Atlus have announced Persona Live 2026: Awakenings, a two-show concert series that is bringing the iconic tunes of the Persona series to the U.S. next year. After a successful run of the Persona Live Tour across Asia, a modified version of the concert is coming to Los Angeles, California, next year on January 24, with just two shows that day. 

Persona Live 2026: Awakenings is the first U.S. show of the Persona Music Experience series, according to Sega, and it will include the "full cast from Japan" when it debuts at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. As someone who lives in Florida, I'm hoping the word "debut" implies that this two-concert series is a test run for a wider U.S. tour. If you live in Hollywood or are willing to travel there for this concert, the first concert will begin at 3 p.m. PT on January 24, followed by a second concert at 8 p.m. PT. 

Here are the performers you can expect at these shows: 

  • Lyn Inaizumi — Singer of Persona 5 series
  • Azumi Takahashi — Singer of Persona 3 Reload
  • Lotus Juice — Rapper and vocalist of Persona 3 & Persona 3 Reload
  • Toshiki Konishi — Composer and guitarist from the Atlus Sound Team
  • Persona Live Dancers

You can sign up here for pre-sale access, with pre-sale tickets going on sale on Wednesday, November 5, before general sale tickets on Friday, November 7. 

In the meantime, read Game Informer's reviews for Persona 5 Royal and Persona 3 Reload. 

Are you going to try and attend this concert series? Let us know in the comments below!
